[[File:Fig 4 BU temoin avec boitier.jpg|gauche|vignette|573x573px|'''Figure 4'''. Control urine dipstick.]]
[[File:Fig 5 BU hematuria.jpg|alt=- Figure 5. Urine dipstick demonstrating haematuria (3 crosses +++).|vignette|574x574px|'''Figure 5.'''' Urine dipstick demonstrating haematuria (3 crosses +++).|left]]

question.question: What does the presence of three plus signs (+++) on a urine dipstick typically indicate?
question.option_a: High levels of glucose in the urine
question.option_b: Presence of nitrites indicating bacterial infection
question.option_c: Presence of blood in the urine (hematuria)
question.option_d: High levels of protein in the urine (proteinuria)
